column4: Hello, how do I find out what disk resembles what hard drive number ex. hd 0,0?
but i want to know what hd resembles which?
does it depend on it's bootorder in the bios?
/dev/sdXY -> X is a letter, Y is a number (X corresponds to drive, Y partition), convert X to a number (a=1, b = 2,etc) and then subtract one from each.
No, but it may be slightly different if you're mixing SATA and PATA drives.  Your BIOS will do all of one type, then all of the other type.
so boot order in the bios does not have any effect on it's numbering?
What partition does linux think its on?
What sort of harddrives do you have in this?
when I use (hd,0,1) it sits at "Starting Up ..."
That means you've passed the thing on to Widnows, and windows is freaking out about something.
You may have to map your partitions/drives, or fiddle with boot.ini (fiddling won't likely be required, mapping is better)
map (hd0) (hd1)\n map (hd1) (hd0) will swap hd1 and hd0 for the OS it boots, etc.
